expandTabs

public static String expandTabs(String toExpand,
                                int tabsize)
Deprecated. 
General-purpose utility function to replace the tabs inside a string according a given tab Size with blanks. This is usefull for listings using monospaced fonts.

Example

        
        String toParse="\t\tpart1\tpart2"; (length:13)
        is converted into:
                part1   part2
        123456789012345678901
The first two tabs are expanded to 8 blanks, the tab between the tokens is expanded to three blanks setting the start of part2 after position 16. It must be noted, that a StringTokenizer would detect only two tokens!

Parameters:
toExpand - The string to process
tabsize - The spacing of the individual tabs.
Returns:
The processed string without tabs, but blanks.

chain

public static String chain(String[] fields,
                           char delim)
Deprecated. 
Concat the fields of a Stringarray with delim

Parameters:
delim - Delimiter-char.
Returns:

replaceAll

public static String replaceAll(String argument,
                                String toReplace,
                                String replacement)
Deprecated. 
This method solves the common problem to find the occurence of a substring and replace it by another String.

Parameters:
argument - The String that we start with
toReplace - The Substring that we want to replace
replacement - The String that we place instead of toReplace
Returns:
a String, where all toReplace parts are substituted by replacement

replaceWhiteChars

public static String replaceWhiteChars(String argument,
                                       char replacement)
Deprecated.

replacement - The char inserted as replacement

getArgumentValues

public static Properties getArgumentValues(String[] args)
                                    throws IllegalArgumentException
Deprecated. Use de.systemagmbh.tools.util.CSysProgArgParser instead.

Parses an array of Commandline - Strings as delivered to main() into handy Properties. Setttings are identified by their name starting with '-' and their value treated as string.

Parameters:
args - an array of Strings as delivered to main()
Returns:
properties if the two Parameters -file Test.txt are present in the array, the properties will contain the entry file=Test.txt
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException
